item.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

summary.text: Denial of Passports to Noncustodial Parents in Cases of Nonpayment of Child Support - Authorizes the Secretary of State to refuse, revoke, restrict, or limit a passport if the applicant or passport holder is a noncustodial parent who is the subject of an outstanding State arrest warrant for nonpayment of child support, where the amount in controversy is not less than $5,000.

bill.title: Denial of Passports to Noncustodial Parents in Cases of Nonpayment of Child Support

item.title: Denial of Passports to Noncustodial Parents in Cases of Nonpayment of Child Support
Concerning denial of passports to noncustodial parents subject to State arrest warrants in cases of nonpayment of child support.
Denial of Passports to Noncustodial Parents in Cases of Nonpayment of Child Support

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
